intro: Zeltnera breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered zeltnera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance, while its flowers are usually white or pale green. Zeltnera breviflora is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
